Australia: Julia Gillard apologises to victims of forced adoption practices for removal of babies from predominantly young single mothers
Kevin Rudd defeats Julia Gillard in a leadership spill, 57 votes to 45. Gillard resigns from parliament, Rudd is sworn in as prime minister.
Australian federal election, 2013: Tony Abbott defeats Kevin Rudd to become the 28th Prime Minister of Australia.
Bangladesh: Hefajot e Islam, a fundamentalist Islamic group, rally in Dhaka demanding death to Bangladeshi atheists and asking for strict application of Islamic laws.
Barbados: Election: Won by Democratic Labour Party-DLP, led by Freundel Stuart
Belgium: Philippe becomes 7th king of the Belgians
Bhutan: The Speaker of the National Assembly, Jigme Tshultim, sentenced to 2 years 6 months imprisonment for official misconduct, fraud, and deceptive practices; and the then Home Minister, Lyonpo Minjur Dorji, and 13 Plot Allotment committee members sentenced to a year imprisonment by the Mongar District Court for official misconduct in the Gyelpozhing land allotment case. On appeal, the convictions and sentences are upheld by the High Court of Bhutan on 16 May and by the Supreme Court on 17 July
Primary round of National Assembly elections held. Results: DCT—12,457 votes; DNT—35,962 votes; PDP-68,650 votes; DPT—93,949 votes.
Final round of National Assembly elections held. Results: PDP-32 seats; DPT—15 seats. New Prime Minister: Tshering Tobgay.
Brazil: A nightclub fire in Santa Maria, Rio Grande do Sul kills at least 242 people.
World Youth Day began in Rio de Janeiro.
Burma: Tensions between Buddhist and Muslim flare into violent clashes in various cities
China: One Belt, One Road was proposed to connect and cooperate among countries primarily between China and rest of Eurasia.
The Shanghai Free-Trade Zone was established.

2013 Tiananmen Square attack: A car was driven into a crowd in Tianamen Square, killing the driver and two passengers, Uyghurs associated with the East Turkestan Islamic Movement, and two pedestrians.
The lunar lander Chang'e 3 landed on the moon.
France: Beginning of the French intervention in Mali against Islamic militants known as Operation Serval (11 January 2013 – 15 July 2014)
Same-sex marriage becomes legal in France, the thirteenth country worldwide to allow it.
Germany: German federal election, 2013: Elections were held to the Bundestag. The FDP failed to meet the electoral threshold. The CDU-CSU coalition and the SPD both gained seats.
India: Indian helicopter bribery scandal comes to light.
Terror attacks in Hyderabad in Dilsukhnagar area.
Mars Orbiter Mission, is successfully launched into Mars orbit by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).
Indinesia: Indonesia host the APEC Summit 2013 in Nusa Dua, Bali.
Italy: Former Prime Minister Giulio Andreotti dies at 94 years old in Rome.
Kenya: Kenyan General Elections are held where Uhuru Kenyatta won the election
Malaysia: 2013 Lahad Datu standoff: Sulu Militants' attempt to siege Lahad Datu District from Sabah, Malaysia.
Philippine: The Enhanced Basic Education Act of 2013, commonly known as K–12 program was signed.
The United Federated States of Bangsamoro Republik (UFSBR) declares its independence from the Philippines
Passenger ship MV St. Thomas Aquinas and cargo ship Sulpicio Express Siete collide in Cebu Strait, killing 115.
The UFSBR ceases to exists as it is defeated in the Zamboanga City crisis.
Miss Philippines Megan Young was crowned Miss World 2013.

A magnitude 7.2 earthquake, whose released energy is found equivalent to 32 Hiroshima bombs, strikes Bohol province, affecting Central Visayas, with 222 people died; the country’s deadliest earthquake since 1990.
A multiple-vehicle collision in Atimonan, Quezon kills at least 20.
Davao Occidental was founded, separating from Davao del Sur; country's 81st province.

Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda) landfalls and devastates the country, with Samar and Leyte most affected, killing at least 6,300 people and leaving millions homeless; one of the most intense tropical cyclones and the deadliest typhoon on record.
A bus falls off an elevated Skyway in Parañaque City, killing at least 18 passengers on board.
Singapore: More than 3000 Singaporeans gathered at the Speakers' Corner, Singapore at Hong Lim Park for a non-partisan protest against the government's Population White Paper which projected a possible 6.9 million people in Singapore by 2030.
Haze in Singapore reaches 401 PSI, the worst in Singapore history.
Taiwan: Ma Ying-jeou meets Pope Francis, the first ROC president to meet with the pope.
USA: Barack Obama is inaugurated for his second term as president.
Boston Marathon bombing: Two pressure cooker bombs explode during the Boston Marathon.

Global surveillance disclosures: The revelations of the NSA's PRISM, Boundless Informant and XKeyscore domestic surveillance programs were first published by The Guardian and Washington Post newspapers.
